item.itunes:summary: The sermon from the Sunday, December 29, 2024, worship service of Atlanta First United Methodist Church by Associate Pastor Rev. Chris Rapko. “Home Alone 12(A.D.): Lost in Jerusalem” in the worship series “Unwrapping the Gift of Joy.” Scripture lesson: Luke 2:41-52 (Common English Bible). Happy New Year! In this week's midweek service we continue to celebrate Christmas as we are in the Twelve Days of Christmas, also called the Season of Christmastide, which are the days between December 25 an...
item.description:
The sermon from the Sunday, December 29, 2024, worship service of Atlanta First United Methodist Church by Associate Pastor Rev. Chris Rapko. “Home Alone 12(A.D.): Lost in Jerusalem” in the worship series “Unwrapping the Gift of Joy.” Scripture lesson: Luke 2:41-52 (Common English Bible).
Happy New Year! In this week's midweek service we continue to celebrate Christmas as we are in the Twelve Days of Christmas, also called the Season of Christmastide, which are the days between December 25 and Epiphany on January 6. Associate Pastor Rev. Chris Rapko's sermon is called “Home Alone 12(A.D.): Lost in Jerusalem” and the scripture lesson is Luke 2:41-52 (Common English Bible).

Download the worship guide at:
http://www.atlantafirstumc.org/pdf/24/AFUMC-Worship-24-12-29.pdf

Download the children's handout at:
http://www.atlantafirstumc.org/pdf/24/AFUMC-Children-24-12-29.pdf

item.itunes:summary: Today Lead Pastor Rev. Jasmine R. Smothers shares Thursday Thoughts: the latest news and happenings at Atlanta First. As we approach the culmination of the Advent Season, Pastor Jasmine invites us to attend three special worship services in the coming week, including the fourth Sunday of Advent, the Longest Night service, and ur Christmas Eve service. She also invites us to continue to serve through financial and supply gifts in support of our Keep Atlanta Warm ministry, which is needed more ...
item.description:
Today Lead Pastor Rev. Jasmine R. Smothers shares Thursday Thoughts: the latest news and happenings at Atlanta First. As we approach the culmination of the Advent Season, Pastor Jasmine invites us to attend three special worship services in the coming week, including the fourth Sunday of Advent, the Longest Night service, and ur Christmas Eve service. She also invites us to continue to serve through financial and supply gifts in support of our Keep Atlanta Warm ministry, which is needed more than ever as the days grow colder. Let's worship, serve, grow and engage together!

Support the show
item.content:encoded:

She also invites us to continue to serve through financial and supply gifts in support of our Keep Atlanta Warm ministry, which is needed more than ever as the days grow colder. Let's worship, serve, grow and engage together!

item.itunes:summary: Happy Thursday, Atlanta First family! Today Lead Pastor Rev. Jasmine R. Smothers shares Thursday Thoughts: the latest news and happenings at Atlanta First. Pastor Jasmine appeals to everyone to redouble our efforts in containing the corona virus. She invites us to worship, as we continue our Advent series "Incarnation: Rediscovering the Significance of Christmas," and invites us to three special upcoming services: Longest Night Worship, Christmas Eve Worship, and Watch Night Worship. Pastor J...
item.description:
Happy Thursday, Atlanta First family! Today Lead Pastor Rev. Jasmine R. Smothers shares Thursday Thoughts: the latest news and happenings at Atlanta First. Pastor Jasmine appeals to everyone to redouble our efforts in containing the corona virus. She invites us to worship, as we continue our Advent series "Incarnation: Rediscovering the Significance of Christmas," and invites us to three special upcoming services: Longest Night Worship, Christmas Eve Worship, and Watch Night Worship. Pastor Jasmine also makes an appeal to serve through financial and supply gifts in support of our Keep Atlanta Warm and Friends at the Front Door Ministries. Let's worship, serve, grow and engage together!

Support the show
item.content:encoded:
Happy Thursday, Atlanta First family! Today Lead Pastor Rev. Jasmine R. Smothers shares Thursday Thoughts: the latest news and happenings at Atlanta First. Pastor Jasmine appeals to everyone to redouble our efforts in containing the corona virus. She invites us to worship, as we continue our Advent series "Incarnation: Rediscovering the Significance of Christmas," and invites us to three special upcoming services: Longest Night Worship, Christmas Eve Worship, and Watch Night Worship. Pastor Jasmine also makes an appeal to serve through financial and supply gifts in support of our Keep Atlanta Warm and Friends at the Front Door Ministries. Let's worship, serve, grow and engage together!

Support the show

Atlanta First! Today Lead Pastor Rev. Jasmine R. Smothers is joined by our Director of Worship and Music Christopher Bryant and our Serve Team lead Mary Jackson as they share Thursday Thoughts: the latest news and happenings at Atlanta First. They share opportunities to worship and grow through our new series for November, "Treasure"; opportunities to serve through Friends at the Front Door; and an opportunity to engage with our 1st Sundays at First Music Series recital this Sunday. Let's worship, serve, grow and engage together!

Support the show

item.itunes:summary: Happy Thursday, Atlanta First family! Today's Thursday Thoughts are shared by Lead Pastor Rev. Jasmine R. Smothers. Pastor Jasmine shares new opportunities to worship and grow with our upcoming "Treasure" generosity and gratitude series; opportunities to serve through our Keep Atlanta Warm and Friends at the Front Door Ministries; and ways to engage through the Atlanta First Mobile App and Face Mask Ministry. Let's worship, serve, grow and engage together! Support the show
